statement:
Let $\mathcal{O}_z$ denote the ring of germs of holomorphic functions at
$z$

Suppose $\mathcal{F}$ is a coherent analytic sheaf on a Stein manifold
$M$. For every $z \in M$, the the stalk ${\mathcal{F}}_z$ is generated
as an ${\mathcal{O}}_z$ module by the germs at $z$ of the
$\Gamma(M,\mathcal{F})$.

Philosophically, this theorem says that there is good supply of of a
coherent analytic sheaf on a Stein manifold.

[9]{} Lars Hörmander. [**]{}, North-Holland Publishing Company, New
York, New York, 1973. Steven G. Krantz. [**]{}, AMS Chelsea Publishing,
Providence, Rhode Island, 1992.
